citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
**Several species housed at the facility (genet, pig) were not included as part of the program of veterinary care. The
facility should have a written program of veterinary care that reflects the current inventory of animals. It is the
responsibility of the facility to develop and implement a written program of veterinary care with the approval of the
attending veterinarian that reflects the current animal inventory.
Correct by December 14, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
**During a review of facility records the environmental enhancement plan for the birds was not available. A species
specific environmental plan should be considered, developed and documented with the approval of the attending
veterinarian. An appropriate species specific environmental plan should be developed according to currently acceptable
best practices and implemented by the facility with the approval of the attending veterinarian and available upon request
by APHIS officials.
Correct by: December 14, 2023
This is a (1st/2nd) Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by February 14, 2024-60 days counted from 1st RL
Inspection or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to
schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
**Several species housed at the facility (genet, pig) were not included as part of the program of veterinary care. The 
facility should have a written program of veterinary care that reflects the current inventory of animals. It is the 
responsibility of the facility to develop and implement a written program of veterinary care with the approval of the 
attending veterinarian that reflects the current animal inventory. 
 
Correct by December 14, 2023 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
**During a review of facility records the environmental enhancement plan for the birds was not available. A species 
specific environmental plan should be considered, developed and documented with the approval of the attending 
veterinarian. An appropriate species specific environmental plan should be developed according to currently acceptable 
best practices and implemented by the facility with the approval of the attending veterinarian and available upon request 
by APHIS officials.  
 
Correct by: December 14, 2023 
 
This is a (1st/2nd) Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by February 14, 2024-60 days counted from 1st RL 
Inspection or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to 
schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
